thread.title: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to give top scorer Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal
thread.title_full: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to give top scorer Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal

author: Alex Smith
title: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to give top scorer Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal
text:
United want him to stay but Ibrahimovic's decision is likely to heavily hinge on whether or not United qualify for next season's Champions League. 
But United legend Neville has insisted he would offer the front man a hefty new agreement. 
He said: "I think United needed personalities and characters after what happened in the previous few seasons. A lot of United's success has revolved around him.' 
"What I would say is, it will be impossible for him to play every single match in that period. Napoli are in for the Swede (Photo: Matthew Peters) Read More Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic refuses to rule out Napoli transfer 
"There has to be a dip at some point. Ultimately, it's how Mourinho manages him over a two-year period because he wants to play every match. 
"The reality is, I'm not quite sure that will be able to happen as he continues to get a little bit older." 
Ibrahimovic has refused to rule out a return to Italy with Napoli. 
"A move to Napoli? You never know. I am feeling well at United, but we will see what happens." poll loading Will Zlatan be at United next season? 3000+ VOTES SO FAR
